website_summaries.verdict: This gentle shampoo is enriched with wheat protein and organic aloe to cleanse and enhance curls, combat frizz, and boost shine on curly or wavy hair.
pros: Allows hair to form its natural curl
You don't need a lot of product to do the trick
Boasts a refreshing citrus scent that will make your hair smell fabulous
cons: A higher price point compared to other brands
Some have said it causes hair to be oily

customer_reviews.title: Fair product, needs some improvements
customer_reviews.text: I have medium length fine, color treated hair with natural loose wavy curls. Pros: it did seem to help bring out the natural curl without effecting my color. Cons: price, smell, drying. The price is high for the product. The scent I find undesirable. It has a slight citronella type smell. It doesn't lather well. I found it dried out my hair. I had to add a small amount of my other shampoo for moisture, scent, and lather. I also had to use a coconut hair mask as the conditioner.
customer_reviews.author: cool girl

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Really like the way my hair feels. I have fine wavy/curly hair and my strands seem to hold together better, instead of being stringy.

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed my scalp
customer_reviews.text: I have never ever had a problem with any brand of shampoo before, but this one destroyed my scalp. It was peeling and flaking and itching, it was so bad I thought at first I had lice (and yes, I had my head checked). The day I stopped using this shampoo my head stopped itching. A few days later my scalp seems to be recovered. I do not have sensitive skin or allergies, so I cannot figure out what the problem is with the shampoo, but I would warn people to stay away. For $23 I deserve better than an itching, flaking, scalp. NOT WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best shampoo for curly heads
customer_reviews.text: (and the price here on Amazon is the best.) I've been using Be Curly for a few years - I have always had curly/wavy hair but now that I'm older the curl and waves are not so much curly wavy - they've become rather lackluster and half hearted. This shampoo (and the conditioner as well) help immensely. It's pricey but not off the charts and if you don't overdo it (you won't need to because it's very rich), it will last a long time. The lemony fragrance is sublime, btw. It's a luxury that's worth being a luxury.

customer_reviews.title: I have embraced the curl!
customer_reviews.text: I have been fighting my curly/frizzy hair my whole life. I recently decided to stop flat ironing it straight and embrace the curl. I switched to Aveda Be Curly Shampoo, Conditioner and Moroccon Oil Intense Curling Cream. It's hard for me to review each of these products individually because I started using all three at the same time. That being said, my hair looks the best it ever has! My curls are soft, yet defined. Even on some humid east coast days my hair held up pretty well. The other product I use as well is Farouk's Biosilk. EMBRACE THE CURL!

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful shampoo for curly heads

I like it a lot. I do recommend, as with all shampoos, that if you are curly headed you only use it every 5 or 6 days or so.

customer_reviews.title: I have fine, curly hair
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a bit high. And, I was very unhappy to see all the sulfates in the ingredient list. I should have been more cautious in reading it before ordering. I have fine, curly hair, and honestly it's been leaving my hair more lifeless than before.
customer_reviews.author: Laura's books

customer_reviews.title: Embrace my curls again
customer_reviews.text: After moving over to the US my hair war terrible dry and frizzy. I always bought cheap products and it works for a while. But after growing so long and the new country (dry air, other water quality etc.), my hair needs much more attention. A friend of mine recommended Aveda and I tried it. What should I say? Awesome! Even after the first wash, I was able to see and feel the results. My curls bounce again and they are right now super soft.
customer_reviews.author: Guest

customer_reviews.title: I have really enjoyed this shampoo
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed this shampoo. It makes my hair very clean and soft though I have not noticed more curls like some have said. I use it everyday on my above shoulder curly hair without it over drying or leaving residue behind. It is expensive but for now it's worth the price for difficult to please curls.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: The Only Shampoo for Frizzy Curly Hair
customer_reviews.text: In the months leading up to my wedding, I was on a quest to find the perfect shampoo and conditioner combination to ensure I had beautiful, frizzless hair on my big day. Aveda got me there! The shampoo itself is a little smelly, and I combine it with Paul Labrecque Curly Condition Milky Cream Conditioner which hides the smell. Don't use too much - the key to curly hair with no frizz is to have a little extra product in your hair to keep it oily. If it dries out too much, it's frizz galore! This shampoo delivered and kept my frizz at bay while making my hair shine in the sun. Recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: LOHAS575

customer_reviews.title: Costs a little more, but I'm worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't buy this shampoo because of the price. Yes, it is expensive, but the results are better than I get at the salon. For curly, frizzy or permed hair, there is nothing that has ever worked this good no matter what I've tried.

HOWEVER, my best friend who has wavy hair loved the definition it gave her waves. I never used much of the shampoo so I wound up giving it away to someone from my church that has very thick, but very soft and fine curly hair and she loves it.

customer_reviews.title: Rich but not heavy
customer_reviews.text: Always looking for the perfect shampoo that will clean my thick, wavy hair and scalp but not dry (color treated) or make my hair frizzy or unmanageable. This shampoo does not require half a bottle to get a good, wonderful-smelling lather, and leaves my hair fresh and smooth, even before conditioner. Aveda's natural products can sometimes be less than stellar (strangely, I did not like the companion conditioner as much but have no issue with mixing and matching products), but when they hit it right, they are perfect --I also discovered and love their eye cream.

product_meta.title: Aveda Be Curly Shampoo, 8.5-Ounce Bottle
product_meta.description: Gently cleanse your waves or curls with a wheat protein and organic aloe blend that expands when hair is wet and retracts when hair is dry.
feature_bullets: Gentle cleansing enhances curl, combats frizz and boosts shine on curly or wavy hair
Dramatically reduces frizz and defines curl up to 57 percent
Refreshing citrus aroma with certified organic lime, lemon, bergamot, orange and other pure plant and flower essences
Enriched with wheat protein and organic aloe blend
